file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-24-01-04 - PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the passenger-cabin floor lining. B. The passenger-cabin floor lining is installed on the floor of the passenger cabin, in zones 231, 232, 241, 242, 251, 252, 261, and 262. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - RE- ALL 25-24-01-000-801-A MOVAL PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - IN- ALL 25-24-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-24-01 Page 1 of 8 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-24-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the passenger-cabin floor lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-06-000-801-A/400 MAIN-DOOR TRIM SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-23-07-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-07-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400 - SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Remove the emergency equipment stowage unit (AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/ 400), if applicable. (2) Remove the windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (3) Remove the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400), if applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-24-01 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove the LH galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400), if applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the sealant from around the rubber carpets (3) in the passenger-cabin front portion, near the galley (SRM 51-20-01). (2) Remove the main door corner trim shrouds ( AMM TASK 25-23-06-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the service door corner trim shrouds (AMM TASK 25-23-07-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-23-07-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (4) Remove the screws (4) that attach the threshold plates (5), (6), (7), (8), (14) and (15). Refer to Figure 401, sheets 2 and 3. (5) Remove the screws (10) and (11) that attach the carpet edge (9) and (12). Refer to DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 3. (6) Remove the inboard seat track cover (13). Refer to DET. G, Figure 401, sheet 3. (7) Remove the carpets from lateral floor lining (2). Refer to DET. A , Figure 401, sheet 1 and DET. G, Figure 401, sheet 3. (8) Remove the carpet from center floor lining (1), between the passenger seat tracks. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (9) Remove the rubber carpets (3) from the floor panel, in the passenger-cabin front portion, near the galley. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-24-01 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-24-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the passenger-cabin floor lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION MAIN-DOOR TRIM SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 25-23-06-400-801-A/400 TION AMM TASK 25-23-07-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-07-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-03-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400 - SRM 51-20-01- - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) 666 Adhesive tape AR 108 Adhesive tape AR RTV780 (Black) Sealant AR RTV157 (Gray) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-24-01 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: Examine the double-face adhesive tapes for general condition. Replace them, if necessary. (1) Install the rubber carpets (3) on the floor lining, in the passenger-cabin front portion, near the galley. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (2) Install the carpet of the center floor lining (1), between the passenger seat tracks. (3) Install the carpets on the lateral floor lining (2), under the passenger seats. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1 and DET. G, Figure 401, sheet 3. (4) Install the inboard seat track covers (13). Refer to DET. G, Figure 401, sheet 3. (5) Install the carpet edge (9) and (12) with the screws (10) and (11). Refer to DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 3. (6) Install the threshold plates (5), (6), (7), (8), (14), and (15) with the screws (4). (7) Apply sealant around the rubber carpets (3) in the passenger-cabin front portion, near the galley (SRM 51-20-01-). (8) Install the service door corner trim shrouds (AMM TASK 25-23-07-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-23-07-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (9) Install the main door corner trim shrouds ( AMM TASK 25-23-06-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) If you removed it, install the emergency equipment stowage unit (AMM TASK 25-26-03-400-801-A/400). (2) If you removed it, install the windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-04-400-801-A/400). (3) If you removed it, install the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-801-A/400). (4) If you removed it, install the LH galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-24-01 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
